PLC ORGANIZES LARGEST STUDY IN MEDICAL HISTORY - ONE GOAL IS TO DEVELOP
BIOMARKERS TO PREDICT WHICH SMOKERS DEVELOP LUNG CANCER
NEW ORLEANS. LA- Cigarette smoking is the causc of ovei 9O percent of all lung
cancer and caused over 143,000 lung cancer deaths in 1991. In that same year 161,000
lung cancer cases were diagnosed. This number is expected to rise ro over 3oo,oo0 new
cases by the year 2000.
While survival rates from other types of cancers have improved dramatically, survival
froin lung cancer has improved by only 1 percent (12% to 13%) in the past 20 years.
The relativcly slow Jecline in smoking trends and the nonspecific nature of lung
premalignancy and early lung cancer symptoms are commonly believed to contribute to
poor survivability.
